ch.supertomcat.bh.keywords

Class Keyword

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.supertomcat.bh.keywords.Keyword
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Keyword>

    public class Keyword
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Keyword>
    A Keyword is an Object with a title, keywords, absolute DownloadPath, relative DownloadPath and a flag which defines if the absolute or relative path is used. With this keywords the user can define a specific path on the harddisk for specific keywords. An example: The user wants that all files containing "Nora Tschirner" in the URL downloaded to C:\Images\Nora Tschirner\ So the user defines a new Keyword. Sets the title to "Nora Tschirner". Then set the keywords for the Keyword. Keywords can be seperator by a space. Groups of keywords can be seperated by a ; Example for keywords: Nora Tschirner or Nora Tschirner; Nora Marie Tschirner Then the user defines an absolute path or a relative path. Example: C:\Images\Nora Tschirner\ or Nora Tschirner\ or N\Nora Tschirner or something else Then the user has the set the flag to use absolute or relative path.
